Raskolnikov stared at Svidrigaïlov in disbelief. 

“Can this be a dream?” he whispered. 

Svidrigaïlov grinned. 

“I’ve come to know you. I’ve heard much about you.” 

Raskolnikov cut him off. 

“You persecuted a girl. You insulted her.” 

Svidrigaïlov shrugged. 

“Am I a monster or a victim? I wanted happiness.” 

“Enough!” Raskolnikov snapped. 

“Whether you’re right or wrong, we dislike you. Leave!” 

Svidrigaïlov laughed. 

“You’re hard to get around! But this is harmless fun!” 

“Still trying to deceive me?” 

“What of it?” Svidrigaïlov replied, still laughing. 

“Let’s just say it’s a game.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts Svidrigaïlov about his past actions and expresses his disdain for him, while Svidrigaïlov attempts to rationalize his behavior.
